title: Calories in a Teaspoon of Olive Oil
meta_description: Discover calories in teaspoon olive oil—about 40 kcal per serving—plus full nutrition breakdown, fats, and healthy cooking tips for your diet.
h1: Calories in a Teaspoon of Olive Oil
assumptions: Extra virgin olive oil; 1 teaspoon = 5 ml or ~4.5 g; room temperature, no additives.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by olive variety, processing (extra virgin vs refined), and exact measurement. Check labels for branded products.

quick_answer.text: One teaspoon of olive oil provides about 40 kcal, mostly from healthy monounsaturated fats.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with product packaging.

tweaks.label: Switch to refined olive oil (less antioxidants, similar calories)
Use avocado oil instead (similar fat profile)
Add to salad dressing with vinegar (no calorie change from oil alone)

faqs.q: How many calories in teaspoon olive oil?
Is olive oil high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, 4.5 g total fat per teaspoon, mostly healthy unsaturated fats.

faqs.q: Does olive oil have carbs or protein?
faqs.a: No carbs, fiber, sugars, or protein—pure fat source.

faqs.q: What's the difference in calories between extra virgin and regular olive oil?
faqs.a: Negligible difference; both ~40 kcal per teaspoon, but extra virgin has more nutrients.

faqs.q: How does teaspoon olive oil fit in a low-carb diet?
faqs.a: Perfect—0 g carbs, adds flavor and healthy fats without spiking blood sugar.
